title: 'Pay Rs 200 cr or...': Mukesh Ambani gets two death threats
description: Mukesh Ambani, chairman of Reliance Industries, received two death threat emails demanding large sums of money. The emails threatened to kill him if he did not comply. The IP address of the emails was traced to a private server in Belgium, and Mumbai police's cybercrime cell is investigating the matter. While the police suspect that the emails may be a hoax, they have not ruled out other possibilities, including a terror angle. Police sources suspect that these could be hoax emails.

title: JEE (Main) to get lighter next year, syllabus soon
description: The National Testing Agency is expected to announce a lighter syllabus for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE-Main) next year. The syllabus has been rationalized, taking into account the reduction in syllabus by various education boards due to the Covid pandemic. The revised syllabus will be released along with the information bulletin and registration dates next week. Additionally, the NTA plans to announce the result dates at the time of registration to assist candidates and institutions in planning their admission cycles.

title: Para-athletes make history with record 111-medal haul at Asiad
description: India's differently abled athletes made history at the Para Asian Games in Hangzhou, winning a record-breaking 111 medals, including 29 gold. This surpassed India's previous highest medal tally in any major multisport event. The athletes' success reflects the government's support through initiatives such as the Khelo India scheme and the Target Olympic Podium Scheme. The Paralympic Committee of India president expressed hope that the country's para-athletes will achieve even greater success at the 2024 Paris Paralympics.

title: UN Gaza vote: Opposition slams India's stand; BJP says can't side with terror
description: The Congress party, along with several other opposition parties, criticised the Indian government for abstaining from voting on the UN resolution on Gaza. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra expressed shock and shame over India's decision, stating that it goes against the principles of non-violence and truth that India stands for. BJP defended its position, stating that the resolution was silent on Hamas' brutality and India would never support terrorism. The opposition parties accused the Modi government of being a subordinate ally of US imperialism and consolidating the US-Israel-India nexus.

title: Breakthrough drug promises longer lives for man's best friend
description: A biotech company called Loyal plans to conduct a large clinical trial to test a revolutionary drug disguised as a sweet treat that has the potential to extend the lives of dogs by at least a year. The trial, which is set to involve 1,000 dogs over the age of 10, aims to determine if the drug can actually increase lifespan and improve the quality of life for older dogs. The identity of the drug is being kept secret until the trial concludes for commercial reasons.

title: New York animal control officer held for selling 'Hope'
description: Scott Casterline, a New York state animal control officer, has been arrested for allegedly selling a stolen pet, a Yorkshire terrier named Hope, instead of reuniting her with her owners. Casterline falsely informed the owners that the dog had died. Hope was later found residing with a different family in Ohio. Casterline is facing charges related to this incident, including official misconduct and misappropriation of property. The original owners expressed their happiness at being reunited with their pet.

title: 'Devil Comet' with horns, ice volcano to light up Earth's skies
description: A comet known as the "Devil Comet" is set to illuminate Earth's skies in mid-April next year. The comet, named Pons-Brooks, has a cycle of approximately 71 years and will be positioned about 232 million kilometers away from our planet. It may be bright enough to see with the naked eye or binoculars. The comet gained attention when astronomers observed "horns" surrounding its nucleus, which are tails composed of gas and dust resulting from unusual outbursts.

title: World Cup: Edwards stars in Netherlands' rout of Bangladesh
description: A clinical bowling effort complemented skipper Scott Edwards' gritty half-century as Netherlands once again punched above their weight to secure a handsome 87-run win over Bangladesh in the World Cup in Kolkata on Saturday. Edwards overcame an edgy start to score a second World Cup fifty and take them to a modest 229 all out after they opted to bat on a fresh Eden wicket hosting its first match of the global showpiece.

title: Former Hamas chief addresses pro-Palestine rally in Kerala
description: The "Youth Resistance Rally" with a tagline of "Uproot Bulldozer Hindutwa and Apartheid Zionism" was organised by Solidarity Movement, an organisation under the state unit of Jamaate Islami Hind.

title: 'Hamas militants used 'poor man's cocaine' during Israel attack'
description: Hamas militants in Gaza reportedly consumed Captagon pills, a synthetic stimulant known as the "poor man's cocaine," during the October 7 terrorist attacks. The pills were found on the bodies of Hamas prisoners and fighters killed in the conflict, suggesting they may have taken the drug before the attacks. Captagon is highly addictive and widely consumed in the Middle East. It is produced in Syria, where its trafficking has contributed to regional violence.

title: 'Outside noise did affect me', reveals KL Rahul
description: India's wicketkeeper-batter KL Rahul revealed on Saturday that despite trying to ignore it for an extended period, the external criticism did have an impact on him during his challenging times. Before his injury, Rahul encountered significant scrutiny and criticism regarding his batting performance. Nonetheless, the team management continued to demonstrate steadfast belief in his abilities. In an IPL match for Lucknow Super Giants against Royal Challengers Bangalore on May 1, Rahul suffered a severe injury where his "tendon was ripped apart."

title: 'Those of Italy origin ...': Amit Shah targets Rahul and Priyanka
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah took a veiled dig at Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, saying that their "origins in Italy" may make it difficult for them to understand the progress achieved by the Narendra Modi government. Shah highlighted the development in India, including the construction of the Ram temple and the abrogation of Article 370, and criticized the Congress for not recognizing the country's growth.

title: Maratha quota: 'Hunger strike across Maharashtra from October 29'
description: Activist Manoj Jarange, who is observing an indefinite fast to demand reservation for the Maratha community, has issued a warning that a series of hunger strikes will commence in every village across Maharashtra from October 29 if the government does not promptly grant the reservation.

title: Worked harder on my fitness than batting during my rehab: Rahul
description: During an IPL match for Lucknow Super Giants against Royal Challengers Bangalore on May 1, KL Rahul - India's wicketkeeper-batter - endured a severe injury where he mentioned that his "tendon was ripped apart." This injury demanded surgical intervention and had a profound impact on both his physical and mental well-being, as he personally attested. However, since his return in the Asia Cup last month, Rahul has showcased his prowess both as a batsman and a wicket-keeper.

title: Indian American leaders join Nasdaq closing bell to celebrate Diwali
description: Gold House and The Asian American Foundation organized a Diwali celebration at Nasdaq MarketSite in New York City, where South Asian executives and leaders from various industries gathered to ring the closing bell. The event aimed to highlight the impact of the South Asian community on society and foster collaboration among business and entertainment communities. Prominent Indian Americans, including entrepreneurs, executives, and filmmakers, were among those who attended the event.

title: Ganguly feels these two teams will be India's main hurdles
description: Former skipper Sourav Ganguly believes that Australia and South Africa will pose the most significant challenges for India as they strive to reclaim the ODI World Cup.

title: 20-25 mins of exercise can prevent sitting-related death risk
description: Regular daily activity may counteract the higher risk of death linked to prolonged sitting, according to a recent health study. Death risk can only be lessened by 20 to 25 minutes of moderate exercise every day.

title: Bangladesh on the boil as call grows for PM Sheikh Hasina to resign
description: One police officer was killed and over 100 people were injured in Bangladesh during a protest demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. The protest, organized by the main opposition party, called for elections to be held under a neutral caretaker government. The rally turned violent with clashes between protesters and police, resulting in the destruction of vehicles and government buildings. The opposition party has threatened more aggressive protests if Hasina does not step down.

title: Pandya to miss World Cup clash against England: Rahul
description: India vice-captain Hardik Pandya will be absent from their World Cup match against England as he remains in the process of recuperating from a left ankle injury. Consequently, the hosts are likely to persist with Suryakumar Yadav, who took Pandya's place, according to statements made by batsman KL Rahul on Saturday. All-rounder Pandya sustained an ankle injury while attempting to stop a shot with his leg during India's seven-wicket triumph over Bangladesh in Pune.

title: Australia pip New Zealand by five runs in World Cup epic
description: In a riveting World Cup showdown in Dharamsala, five-time champions Australia clinched a narrow five-run victory against a resilient New Zealand side. The match, set against the backdrop of the Himalayas, was a high-scoring thriller. Australia posted a formidable total of 388 runs before being all out. Travis Head's impressive 109 and David Warner's contribution of 81 set the tone for their innings. New Zealand fought back valiantly, with Rachin Ravindra scoring 116, supported by Daryl Mitchell's 54 and Jimmy Neesham's rapid 33-ball fifty.

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) questions PM Modi's 'U-turn' on Pawar
description: The Shiv Sena (UBT) on Saturday hit back at PM Narendra Modi over his comments referring to NCP chief and former Union agriculture minister Sharad Pawar.

title: Why India abstained in UN's Gaza resolution
description: India abstained from voting on a non-binding resolution in the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) that called for a humanitarian truce between Israeli forces and Hamas militants in Gaza. While India did not vote for the resolution, it supported an amendment that condemned the terrorist attacks by Hamas. India expressed concerns about the humanitarian crisis in Gaza and called for de-escalation and a negotiated two-state solution for the Israel-Palestine issue.

title: How 'fake' ticket sellers are targeting Cricket World Cup enthusiasts on social media
description: To gain the confidence of gullible cricket fans, the crooks are posting made-up stories, like-- friend ditched last minute, and there is extra ticket available. Direct message to buy it.

title: Unfair to start witch hunt, says Mickey Arthur
description: Mickey Arthur, the director of cricket for Pakistan, believes it's unjust to initiate a witch hunt, as captain Babar Azam and chief selector Inzamam-ul-Haq have faced harsh criticism from various quarters due to the team's lacklustre performance in the ongoing World Cup.

title: Kashi Vishwanath temple trust to discuss dress code proposal
description: The Kashi Vishwanath temple trust is set to consider a proposal for implementing a dress code for pilgrims at its upcoming meeting, trust's chairman, Nagendra Pandey said on Saturday.

title: 'Worse than earthquake': Gaza hammered as Israel continues to expand ground operations
description: Israeli forces have entered Gaza in a ground offensive following attacks from Hamas. The Israeli military has increased its strikes and announced an expansion of its ground operation. They have targeted underground infrastructure and killed several Hamas terrorists. Israel has also cut off internet and communications in the strip, leaving 2.3 million people isolated. The Israeli government expects it will take a long time to dismantle Hamas' network of tunnels. Concern remains for over 200 hostages being held by Hamas.

title: Emirates' premium economy to debut in India on October 30
description: Emirates has debuted its premium economy cabin in the Indian market as part of its ongoing aircraft retrofit project. The airline has retrofitted two A380s with premium economy seats, which will operate flights from Dubai to Mumbai and Bengaluru. Emirates already offers premium economy on flights to nine other destinations globally. The premium economy cabins feature 56 cream leather seats with more legroom and a generous recline, as well as an elevated dining experience. The airline expects the product to be highly popular in India.

title: Starlink to provide services to int'l aid organizations in Gaza: Musk
Woman shot dead inside her house in Delhi's Jaitpur area
description: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly shot to death by an armed assailant in front of her brother and mother in southeast Delhi's Jaitpur area on Friday evening.

title: 'PCB chief has stopped taking Babar's calls'
description: Babar Azam's tenure as the captain of the Pakistan cricket team might be in jeopardy as former Pakistani wicketkeeper Rashid Latif, who is known for fueling conspiracy theories, alleged on Saturday that Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Zaka Ashraf has been unresponsive to Babar's calls and text messages. "I know for a fact that Babar has got no response from the Chairman (Zaka Ashraf) when he called and messaged from India," Latif claimed on the state-owned PTV sports channel.

title: Nisar satellite will aid understand forests & wetlands better: JPL
description: The Nasa-Isro Synthetic Aperture Radar (Nisar) satellite, set to launch in 2024, will provide researchers with unprecedented insight into Earth's forests and wetlands. The mission aims to understand how changes in these ecosystems impact the global carbon cycle and climate change. Nisar will scan the entire land and ice surfaces of Earth every 12 days, using advanced radar technology to track land-cover changes and study the movement of carbon between the atmosphere, land, ocean, and living organisms. The data will contribute to understanding deforestation.

title: 'Keshav told me that it was...': Shamsi on his survival
description: Tabraiz Shamsi visibly breathed a sigh of relief after narrowly surviving a close leg-before-wicket (lbw) appeal that was decided as 'Umpire's Call.' This critical decision effectively sealed Pakistan's fate in the World Cup, following their one-wicket loss to South Africa, marking their fourth consecutive defeat in the tournament. In the pursuit of 271 runs, the Proteas found themselves at their last pair, and Tabraiz Shamsi faced a fervent lbw appeal from Haris Rauf. The on-field umpire initially ruled it as not out.

title: 'I think he escaped from pressure': Gul blasts Shadab
description: Former Pakistani fast bowler Umar Gul strongly criticised all-rounder Shadab Khan for leaving the field during a pivotal moment in the team's World Cup match against South Africa in Chennai. Pakistan faced their fourth consecutive defeat on Friday, effectively diminishing their chances of progressing further in the tournament. Umar expressed doubt regarding the severity of the concussion injury Shadab sustained while fielding at mid-off, indicating that he didn't think it warranted him leaving the field.

title: Explainer: Why US is trying to 'modernise' its main nuclear bomb
description: This modernisation is part of a larger effort by the US to upgrade and maintain its nuclear arsenal, which includes warheads, missiles, bombers, and submarines. The B61 is a gravity bomb, which means it is dropped from an aircraft and falls to its target by gravity. It has been in service since 1968 and has several versions with different yields and features. The B61-12 is the latest version, which was first produced in 2020 and has a maximum yield of 50 kilotons. It also has a tail kit that makes it more accurate and adaptable.

title: Italian national found dead inside Chhattisgarh hotel room
description: The deceased, identified as Mori Francesco, 71, was an Italian resident and a professional engineer who had recently arrived in Jagdalpur to offer his services at the NMDC steel plant. Hailing from the Italian city of Italiana, Mori had been staying at the hotel since October 17. His other Italian friends were also staying in the same hotel.

title: 'Gave Parl credentials to Darshan Hiranandani', Mahua says
description: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra admitted to entrusting her Parliament login credentials to businessman Darshan Hiranandani in order to have his office assist in typing questions for the Lok Sabha. She denied involvement in accepting money from him and dismissed allegations of a 'cash-for-query' scandal. Moitra stated that she would read the questions before they were submitted and claimed that Hiranandani should produce verified records of any gifts or favors she purportedly received from him. The Ethics Committee has questioned both Moitra and BJP MP Nishikant Dubey on the matter.

title: Mass suicide in Gujarat: 7, including 3 children, dead
description: ​​The deceased have been identified as Manish Solanki, his wife, parents, and three children.

title: Apple announced fall event: M3 chips, MacBook Pro, iMac, and more
description: Apple has announced its second fall event, scheduled for October 30, which will focus on the Mac lineup. It is expected that Apple will unveil updates to several Mac models, including new MacBook Pros and a refresh to the 24-inch iMac. The new laptops are rumored to feature the new M3 Pro and M3 Max chips, offering improved performance and gaming capabilities.

title: Rozgar Mela drive: PM Modi distributes over 51k appointment letters
description: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday distributed over 51,000 appointment letters to recruits under the government's Rozgar Mela drive. The Rozgar Mela will be held at 37 locations across the country. A statement said recruitments are taking place across central government departments as well as in those states and UTs supporting the initiative. Recruits will join a host of departments, including railways, posts, home affairs, revenue, higher education, school education and literacy, health and family welfare, among others.

title: ICC World Cup: Unstoppable India face deflated England
description: India and England have been playing different strategies in the World Cup, with India leading by Rohit Sharma and chasing targets in five consecutive games. This trend is expected to continue in their upcoming match on Sunday. England, known for their aggressive style in white-ball cricket, are struggling in Indian conditions and may face an early exit from the tournament. The match is expected to be a critical one that may determine the fate of both teams in the World Cup.

title: 'Earth’s core may be leaking a rare and valuable element'
description: Scientists have discovered that Earth's core may be leaking helium-3, a rare and valuable element. The high levels of helium-3 and neon-22 found in volcanic rocks on Baffin Island suggest that these rocks came from the core itself. It is believed that helium-3 and neon-22 have been leaking from the core for millions or billions of years, but at a very slow rate. While the leakage does not have any negative impact on the planet, it could have positive implications for nuclear fusion.

title: Asian Games: Indian para athletes create history with 111 medals
description: Indian para athletes achieved a record 111 medals at the Hangzhou Asian Para Games, the most for the country in any major international multi-sport event. They won 29 gold, 31 silver, and 51 bronze medals, placing fifth in the medal count. India surpassed 2018's best Asian Para Games tally of 72 medals, earning 39 more medals, and athletics accounting for 55 of India's total of 111 medals. "We have made history, our para athletes have made the country proud," Paralympic Committee of India president Deepa Malik said.

title: Sajjan Jindal backs Narayana Murthy’s 70hr work week call
description: JSW Group Chairman Sajjan Jindal has expressed his support for NR Narayana Murthy's call for a dedicated labor force in India that does 70 hours work in a week. Jindal emphasizes the need for dedication in building India's economic strength and believes that a shorter work week culture is not suitable for a rapidly developing country like India.

title: Sahasra Semiconductors 1st Indian co to produce memory chips
description: Rajasthan-based Sahasra Semiconductors has become the first Indian company to produce memory chips. They have commenced production at their Bhiwadi unit and have already shipped micro-SD cards to various ecommerce platforms.

title: Google anti-trust trial: Who is Prabhakar Raghavan?
description: Raghavan, senior VP at Google, testified during the antitrust trial against the tech giant that began on October 10, 2023. The trial is the result of a lawsuit filed by the US Department of Justice in 2020, accusing Google of abusing its dominant position in online search and advertising to stifle competition and harm consumers. "I feel a keen sense not to become the next road kill," said Raghavan, who reports to chief executive Sundar Pichai. Raghavan was born in India and studied electrical engineering and computer science at IIT Madras and the University of California, Berkeley.

title: Explained: How the DRS works in case of close LBW decision
description: The Decision Review System (DRS) was a topic of debate in the ICC World Cup match between Pakistan and South Africa in Chennai. South Africa were on the verge of a 271-run target, but Pakistan bowlers took five quick wickets to reduce them to 260/9. With eleven runs needed by South Africa in 4.3 overs and just one wicket between Pakistan and a win, a controversial moment occurred when Haris Rauf bowled to tailender Tabraiz Shamsi, but the umpire turned down Pakistan's appeal for an LBW.

title: Israel-Hamas, Ukraine, China: Is US getting overextended?
description: The US is facing simultaneous challenges in the Middle East, Ukraine, and with China, causing concerns that it may be overextended. The defense industry is struggling to produce enough weapons, raising worries that some partners may be shortchanged. The crisis in the Middle East has disrupted the US's plan to focus more on the threat from China. The upcoming presidential election and possible return of Donald Trump also adds to the alarm.

title: Mukesh Ambani receives death threat, told to pay Rs 20 crore
description: According to police, the mailer threatened to shoot him if he failed to pay Rs 20 crore.

title: How to get your vehicle's PUC certificate online: Step-by-step guide
description: In India, it is mandatory for all vehicles to have a valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificate, which proves that their emissions are within the permissible limits.

title: NPS exit rule change: Know all details
description: As per the PFRDA's circular dated October 25, 2023, successful penny-drop verification, along with name matching, is necessary for processing exit/withdrawal requests and updating subscriber bank account details.

title: NPS exit rule change: Know all details
description: As per the PFRDA's circular dated October 25, 2023, successful penny-drop verification, along with name matching, is necessary for processing exit/withdrawal requests and updating subscriber bank account details.

title: Punjab: School teacher hits youth with car, drags him for 10km
Musk's vision for X: 'A fully-fledged dating site by 2024'
description: Elon Musk discussed new concepts for his social media platform, X, during a video conference. One idea discussed was incorporating dating app features into the platform. Musk envisions X becoming a fully-fledged dating site by 2024, in addition to functioning as a digital bank. However, Musk did not provide specific details on how the transformation would occur or if there was demand for such features. This aligns with Musk's push for features that require payment, as most dating apps operate on a subscription model.

title: Outrage over 'umpire's call' that denied Pak win vs SA
description: Pakistan suffered a one-wicket defeat in the ICC World Cup against South Africa in Chennai. The Pakistan bowlers took five wickets for 54 runs to get back into the game. However, South Africa needed 11 runs and had five overs to complete the match. A controversial moment occurred when Haris Rauf bowled to tailender Tabraiz Shamsi, but the umpire turned down Pakistan's appeal for an LBW. Skipper Babar Azam requested a review, but lost it on 'umpire's call'.

title: UP youth held for killing brother for woman they both loved
description: The police in Rae Bareli, India, have arrested a man on charges of murdering his brother. The younger brother, Nitin, was found dead near his village last week. After examining mobile phone records, it became clear that the arrested brother, Lallan, had been in contact with a woman Nitin was planning to marry. Lallan confessed to the crime after evidence was presented to him. The police have also called the woman for questioning and informed her father about the case.

title: Here’s how much Google paid to be default search engine on devices
description: Google is defending itself against antitrust allegations by the US government, which claims the tech giant illegally monopolized the online search space by paying billions to be the default search engine on various platforms. During cross-examination, the company revealed that it spent $26.3 billion in 2021 to secure this position.

title: Gandhisagar Sanctuary to be home of next batch of cheetahs
X launches 2 new subscription plans, price starts at Rs 244 per month
description: Social media platform X has launched two new subscription plans, Basic and Premium+, to mark the one-year anniversary of Elon Musk taking over Twitter. The Basic plan offers features such as a boost to replies, the ability to edit and post longer tweets, and encrypted DMs. The Premium+ plan, which is ad-free, offers additional features including access to Media Studio and analytics. Prices for the plans in India range from Rs 244 to Rs 13,600 per month, depending on the subscription option chosen.

title: NBA: Jokic powers Nuggets past pesky Grizzlies
description: The Denver Nuggets emerged victorious in a closely contested NBA game against the Memphis Grizzlies, winning 108-104 on the road. Nikola Jokic and Jamal Murray both scored 22 points to lead the Nuggets to victory. The Grizzlies displayed a balanced scoring effort with six players reaching double-digit points, but it was not enough to overcome the Nuggets' strong performance.

title: PM: 5G taking India from developing to developed
description: Prime Minister Modi highlighted India's leadership in technology and the rapid adoption of telecom services like 5G as key factors in the country's transition from a developing nation to a developed one. He criticized the previous government's "policy paralysis," comparing it to an outdated smartphone that couldn't be revived. Modi emphasized the growth in manufacturing and industry since his government took charge and called for more effort in building a strong semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem in India.

title: Maine mass shooting suspect found dead
description: The main suspect in the Maine mass shooting, Robert Card, has been found dead, ending a 48-hour manhunt. He was suspected of killing 18 and injuring 13 people in a shooting spree at a bowling alley and bar. Card, a US Army reservist with mental health issues, died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. This marks the 36th mass killing in the United States this year according to AP and USA Today data maintained in partnership with Northeastern University.

title: 34% rise in entities filing tax returns of over Rs 500cr in FY21
description: According to the latest data released by the income tax department, 589 taxpayers filed returns with a gross total income of over Rs 500 crore in the assessment year 2021-22. This is a 34% increase from the previous year. Additionally, approximately 2.1 crore taxpayers paid taxes but did not file returns in 2021-22. The rise in returns and incomes can be attributed to robust economic growth, rising corporate profits, higher household incomes, and the use of big data and technology by tax authorities.

title: Six-year-old nails dad, uncle for mom's murder
description: Vipin Saxena and his brother Akash have been sentenced to life in jail for killing Vipin's wife. The main evidence in the case came from the couple's six-year-old daughter, who witnessed the crime. Vipin initially claimed that his wife had fallen down the stairs during an argument with his brother. However, it was revealed that Vipin had been having an affair and physically abusing his wife. The court relied on the daughter's testimony and other evidence, including an autopsy report with multiple injuries, to convict the brothers.

title: Six-year-old nails dad, uncle for mom's murder
description: Vipin Saxena and his brother Akash have been sentenced to life in jail for killing Vipin's wife. The main evidence in the case came from the couple's six-year-old daughter, who witnessed the crime. Vipin initially claimed that his wife had fallen down the stairs during an argument with his brother. However, it was revealed that Vipin had been having an affair and physically abusing his wife. The court relied on the daughter's testimony and other evidence, including an autopsy report with multiple injuries, to convict the brothers.

title: Four-year-old video posted, deleted by BJP causes a stir
description: A four-year-old video shared by BJP on social media of deputy chief minister Devendra Fadnavis saying he will return to helm the state has rocked the political and bureaucratic circles."I will return for building a new Maharashtra," the state BJP posted on Friday on X, along with the video. The post was deleted a few hours later after BJP leadership took objection over the content on the grounds that such a post would create instability in the three-party Mahayuti government, which is already on a shaky wicket owing to intra-alliance disputes.

title: Four-year-old video posted, deleted by BJP causes a stir
description: A four-year-old video shared by BJP on social media of deputy chief minister Devendra Fadnavis saying he will return to helm the state has rocked the political and bureaucratic circles."I will return for building a new Maharashtra," the state BJP posted on Friday on X, along with the video. The post was deleted a few hours later after BJP leadership took objection over the content on the grounds that such a post would create instability in the three-party Mahayuti government, which is already on a shaky wicket owing to intra-alliance disputes.

title: Bengal minister tells court he needs medical aid, then faints
description: Bengal minister Jyoti Priya Mallick was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with an alleged ration pilferage scam. Mallick, accused of refusing to cooperate in the investigation, collapsed and vomited when produced in court. He was admitted to a private hospital after being remanded in ED custody. Mallick claimed to be a victim of a political conspiracy by the BJP and Suvendu Adhikari. The ED alleged that the prime accused transferred money to companies linked to Mallick's family. Mallick's lawyer dismissed the allegations as unfounded.

title: Bengal minister tells court he needs medical aid, then faints
description: Bengal minister Jyoti Priya Mallick was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with an alleged ration pilferage scam. Mallick, accused of refusing to cooperate in the investigation, collapsed and vomited when produced in court. He was admitted to a private hospital after being remanded in ED custody. Mallick claimed to be a victim of a political conspiracy by the BJP and Suvendu Adhikari. The ED alleged that the prime accused transferred money to companies linked to Mallick's family. Mallick's lawyer dismissed the allegations as unfounded.
